parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To show, display, point out, indicate; I prove, demonstrate. From epi and deiknuo; to exhibit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Money, coin. From nomizo; what is reckoned as of value, i.e. Current coin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A poll-tax. Of Latin origin; properly, an enrollment, i.e. a tax.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A denarius, a small Roman silver coin. Of Latin origin; a denarius.
